bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_digitizers.digi_template¶

class bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_digitizers.digi_template.hdfMap_digi_template(digi_group)¶

Bases: object

When inheriting from template, the new class must define the class attribute __predefined_adc that is specific to that digitizer.

bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_digitizers.sis3301¶

class bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_digitizers.sis3301.hdfMap_digi_sis3301(digi_group)¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_digitizers.digi_template.hdfMap_digi_template

_hdfMap_digi_sis3301__adc_info(adc_name, config_group)¶
_hdfMap_digi_sis3301__build_data_configs()¶

Builds self.data_configs dictionary. A dict. entry follows:

data_configs[config_name] = {
    'active': True/False,
    'adc': [list of active analog-digital converters],
    'group name': 'name of config group',
    'group path': 'absolute path to config group',
    'SIS 3301': [(brd,
             [ch,],
             {'bit': 14,
              'sample rate': (100.0, 'MHz')}
             ), ]
    }
_hdfMap_digi_sis3301__find_adc_connections(adc_name, config_group)¶
static _hdfMap_digi_sis3301__find_config_adc(config_group)¶
_hdfMap_digi_sis3301__predefined_adc = ['SIS 3301']¶
construct_dataset_name(board, channel, config_name=None, adc='SIS 3301', return_info=False)¶

Returns the name of a HDF5 dataset based on its configuration name, board, and channel. Format follows:

‘config_name [brd:ch]’
Parameters:
  • board –
  • channel –
  • config_name –
  • adc –
  • return_info –
Returns:
static is_config_active(config_name, dataset_names)¶

The naming of a dataset starts with the name of its corresponding configuration. This scans ‘dataset_names’ fo see if ‘config_name’ is used in the list of datasets.

Parameters:
  • config_name –
  • dataset_names –
Returns:
static parse_config_name(name)¶

Parses ‘name’ to see if it matches the naming scheme for a data configuration group. A group representing a data configuration has the scheme:

Configuration: config_name
Parameters:name –
Returns:

_hdfMap_digi_siscrate__adc_info(adc_name, config_group)¶
_hdfMap_digi_siscrate__build_data_configs()¶

Builds self.data_configs dictionary. A dict. entry follows:

data_configs[config_name] = {
    'active': True/False,
    'adc': [list of active analog-digital converters],
    'group name': 'name of config group',
    'group path': 'absolute path to config group',
    'SIS 3301': [(brd,
                  [ch,],
                  {'bit': 14,
                   'sample rate': (100.0, 'MHz')}), ]}

static brd_to_slot(brd, adc)¶
construct_dataset_name(board, channel, config_name=None, adc=None, return_info=False)¶

Returns the name of a HDF5 dataset based on its configuration name, board, channel, and adc. Format follows:

‘config_name [Slot #: SIS #### FPGA # ch #]’
Parameters:
  • board –
  • channel –
  • config_name –
  • adc –
  • return_info –
Returns:
static is_config_active(config_name, dataset_names)¶

The naming of a dataset starts with the name of its corresponding configuration. This scans ‘dataset_names’ fo see if ‘config_name’ is used in the list of datasets.

Parameters:
  • config_name –
  • dataset_names –
Returns:
static parse_config_name(name)¶

Parses ‘name’ to see if it matches the naming scheme for a data configuration group. A group representing a data configuration has the scheme:

config_name
